From Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, to further the promise of life in Christ Jesus,
undefined to Timothy, my dear child. Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord!Thanksgiving and Charge to Timothy
undefined I am thankful to God, whom I have served with a clear conscience as my ancestors did, when I remember you in my prayers as I do constantly night and day.
undefined As I remem-ber your tears, I long to see you, so that I may be filled with joy.
undefined I recall your sincere faith that was alive first in your grandmother Lois and in your mother Eunice, and I am sure is in you.
undefined Because of this I remind you to rekin-dle God’s gift that you possess through the laying on of my hands.
undefined For God did not give us a Spirit of fear but of power and love and self-control.
undefined So do not be ashamed of the testimony about our Lord or of me, a pris-oner for his sake, but by God’s power accept your share of suffering for the gospel.
undefined He is the one who saved us and called us with a holy calling, not based on our works but on his own purpose and grace, granted to us in Christ Jesus before time began,
undefined but now made visible through the appearing of our Savior Christ Jesus. He has broken the power of death and brought life and immortality to light through the gospel!
undefined For this gospel I was appointed a preacher and apostle and teacher.

undefined Because of this, in fact, I suffer as I do. But I am not ashamed, because I know the one in whom my faith is set and I am convinced that he is able to protect what has been en-trusted to me until that day.
undefined Hold to the standard of sound words that you heard from me and do so with the faith and love that are in Christ Jesus.
undefined Protect that good thing entrusted to you, through the Holy Spirit who lives within us.
undefined You know that everyone in the prov-ince of Asia deserted me, including Phygelus and Hermogenes.
undefined May the Lord grant mercy to the family of Onesiphorus, because he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my imprisonment.
undefined But when he arrived in Rome, he eagerly searched for me and found me.
undefined May the Lord grant him to find mer-cy from the Lord on that day! And you know very well all the ways he served me in Ephe-sus.Serving Faithfully Despite Hardship
So you, my child, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
undefined And entrust what you heard me say in the presence of many others as witnesses to faithful people who will be competent to teach others as well.
undefined Take your share of suffering as a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
undefined No one in military service gets entangled in matters of everyday life; other-wise he will not please the one who recruited him.
undefined Also, if anyone competes as an ath-lete, he will not be crowned as the winner un-less he competes according to the rules.
undefined The farmer who works hard ought to have the first share of the crops.
undefined Think about what I am saying and the Lord will give you under-standing of all this.
undefined Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, a descendant of David; such is my gos-pel,
undefined for which I suffer hardship to the point of imprisonment as a criminal, but God’s mes-sage is not imprisoned!
undefined So I endure all things for the sake of those chosen by God, that they too may obtain salvation in Christ Jesus and its eternal glory.
undefined This saying is trustworthy:If we died with him, we will also live with him.
undefined If we endure, we will also reign with him.If we deny him, he will also deny us.
undefined If we are unfaithful, he remains faithful, since he cannot deny himself.Dealing with False Teachers
undefined Remind people of these things and solemnly charge them before the Lord not to wrangle over words. This is of no benefit; it just brings ruin on those who listen.
undefined Make every effort to present yourself before God as a proven worker who does not need to be ashamed, teaching the message of truth accu-rately.
undefined But avoid profane chatter, because those occupied with it will stray further and further into ungodliness,
undefined and their mes-sage will spread its infection like gangrene. Hymenaeus and Philetus are in this group.
undefined They have strayed from the truth by saying that the resurrection has already occurred, and they are undermining some people’s faith.
undefined However, God’s solid foundation remains standing, bearing this seal: “The Lord knows those who are his,” and “Everyone who con-fesses the name of the Lord must turn away from evil.”
undefined Now in a wealthy home there are not only gold and silver vessels, but also ones made of wood and of clay, and some are for honorable use, but others for ignoble use.
undefined So if someone cleanses himself of such behav-ior, he will be a vessel for honorable use, set apart, useful for the Master, prepared for every good work.
undefined But keep away from youthful passions, and pursue righteousness, faithful-ness, love, and peace, in company with others who call on the Lord from a pure heart.
undefined But reject foolish and ignorant controversies, because you know they breed infighting.
undefined And the Lord’s slave must not engage in heat-ed disputes but be kind toward all, an apt teacher, patient,
undefined correcting opponents with gentleness. Perhaps God will grant them repentance and then knowledge of the truth
undefined and they will come to their senses and escape the devil’s trap where they are held captive to do his will.Ministry in the Last Days
But understand this, that in the last days difficult times will come.
undefined For people will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boastful, arrogant, blasphemers, disobedient to parents, ungrateful, unholy,
undefined unloving, ir-reconcilable, slanderers, without self-control, savage, opposed to what is good,
undefined treacher-ous, reckless, conceited, loving pleasure rather than loving God.
undefined They will maintain the outward appearance of religion but will have repudiated its power. So avoid people like these.
undefined For some of these insinuate them-selves into households and captivate weak women who are overwhelmed with sins and led along by various passions.
undefined Such women are always seeking instruction, yet never able to arrive at a knowledge of the truth.
undefined And just as Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so these people – who have warped minds and are disqualified in the faith – also oppose the truth.
undefined But they will not go much further, for their foolishness will be obvious to every-one, just like it was with Jannes and Jambres.Continue in What You Have Learned
undefined You, however, have followed my teaching, my way of life, my purpose, my faith, my patience, my love, my endurance,
undefined as well as the persecutions and sufferings that happened to me in Antioch, in Iconium, and in Lystra. I endured these persecutions and the Lord delivered me from them all.
undefined Now in fact all who want to live godly lives in Christ Jesus will be persecuted.
undefined But evil people and charlatans will go from bad to worse, deceiving others and being deceived themselves.
undefined You, however, must continue in the things you have learned and are confi-dent about. You know who taught you
undefined and how from infancy you have known the holy writings, which are able to give you wis-dom for salvation 	through faith in Christ Jesus.
undefined Every scripture is inspired by God and useful for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for training in righteousness,
undefined that the person dedicated to God may be capable and equipped for every good work.Charge to Timothy Repeated
I solemnly charge you before God and Christ Jesus, who is going to judge the living and the dead, and by his appearing and his kingdom:
undefined Preach the message, be ready whether it is convenient or not, reprove, re-buke, exhort with complete patience and in-struction.

undefined For there will be a time when people will not tolerate sound teaching. In-stead, following their own desires, they will accumulate teachers for themselves, because they have an insatiable curiosity to hear new things.
undefined And they will turn away from hear-ing the truth, but on the other hand they will turn aside to myths.
undefined You, however, be self-controlled in all things, endure hardship, do an evangelist’s work, fulfill your ministry.
undefined For I am already being poured out as an offering, and the time for me to depart is at hand.
undefined I have competed 	well; I have finished the race; I have kept the faith!

undefined Finally the crown of righteousness is reserved for me. The Lord, the righteous Judge, will award it to me in that day – and not to me only, but also to all who have set their affection on his appearing. Travel Plans and Concluding Greetings
undefined Make every effort to come to me soon.
undefined For Demas deserted me, since he loved the present age, and he went to Thessalonica. Crescens went to Galatia and Titus to Dalma-tia.
undefined Only Luke is with me. Get Mark and bring him with you, because he is a great help to me in ministry.
undefined Now I have sent Tychi-cus to Ephesus.

undefined Alexander the coppersmith did me a great deal of harm. The Lord will repay him in keeping with his deeds.
undefined You be on guard against him too, because he vehemently opposed our words.
undefined At my first defense no one ap-peared in my support; instead they all deserted me – may they not be held accountable for it.
undefined But the Lord stood by me and strength-ened me, so that through me the message would be fully proclaimed for all the Gentiles to hear. And so I was delivered from the lion’s mouth!
undefined The Lord will deliver me from every evil deed and will bring me safely into his heavenly kingdom. To him be glory for ever and ever! Amen.
undefined Greetings to Prisca and Aquila and the family of Onesiphorus.
undefined Erastus stayed in Corinth. Trophimus I left ill in Miletus.
undefined Make every effort to come before winter. Greetings to you from Eubulus, Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brothers and sisters.
